thread.title: Facebook’s Days as an Unregulated Monopoly May Be Numbered

author: Greg Ip
title: Facebook’s Days as an Unregulated Monopoly May Be Numbered
text:
Facebook Inc.’s climb to the pinnacle of business success was nurtured by a grand policy experiment: that a light regulatory touch would turbocharge innovation and make consumers wealthier and happier. Companies who mistreated their customers would succumb to competitors, or be punished with rules already on the books.
The events of the last few months suggest the experiment may have run its course. It has left Facebook effectively an unregulated monopoly and despite founder Mark Zuckerberg’s latest apologies, the company... RELATED VIDEO Zuckerberg Through Time: How Facebook's Message Has Changed What exactly is Facebook? It depends on when you asked Mark Zuckerberg. To see how Facebook became an election-influencing player, we dug into the archives and looked at the company's changing view of itself. Photo Illustration: Heather Seidel/The Wall Street Journal; Photos: Associated Press
